intro: Xanthophyllum amoenum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, which give the plant its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Xanthophyllum amoenum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
